Package no.geosoft.timeseries.util

Class RunningPercentile

java.lang.Object
no.geosoft.timeseries.util.RunningPercentile
public final class RunningPercentile extends Object
Class for computing the running percentile (such as median) for a set of observations without holding any of the observations.

Implemented using the P-Squared algorithm of Raj Jain and Imrich Chlamtac:

https://www.cse.wustl.edu/~jain/papers/ftp/psqr.pdf

The present implementation is a simplified version of the following: https://github.com/jacksonicson/psquared.

There is also an Apache implementation that seems overly complex: PSquaredPercentile.java.

Author:
Jacob Dreyer

  • Constructor Details

    • RunningPercentile

      public RunningPercentile(double p)
      Create a running percentile computation instance for the specified percentile target. p = 0.5 for median, p = 0.25 for the Q1 quartile etc.
      Parameters:
      p - Percentile target. [0.0,1.0].
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If p is outside bounds.
